text: Felicitas Schlarp or Felicitas Schubeck (born 1907) was a German track and field athlete who was mainly active in the 100 metres and long jump events in the late 1920s and early 1930s. She was a member of Post SV Köln and the German national team. Schlarp became for the first time national champion in the long jump in 1929 in a new national record with 5.65 metres.Rekorde der Leichtathletik, Weitsprung Frauen auf rekorde-im-sport.de, abgerufen am 29. März 2021 She became again national champion in 1931 after finishing third in 1930. Schlarp represented Germany at international competitions, includig at 1928 Germany–Netherlands women's athletics competition and at the 1929 Netherlands–Germany women's athletics competition where she won the long jump event. At the 1930 Women's World Games she reached the final of the long jump event and finished fifth. ==References== Category:1907 births Category:Year of death missing Category:Sportspeople from North Rhine-Westphalia Category:German long jumpers Category:German sprinters
title: Felicitas Schlarp
